Literature.Title: In vitro and in vivo antitrypanosomal activities of three peptide antibiotics: leucinostatin A and B, alamethicin I and tsushimycin.
Literature.Author: Ishiyama A, Otoguro K, Iwatsuki M, Namatame M, Nishihara A, Nonaka K, Kinoshita Y, Takahashi Y, Masuma R, Shiomi K, Yamada H, Omura S

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Trypanosoma brucei brucei GUT Tat3.1(IC50=1.09µg/ml),Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense(IC50=2.49µg/ml),Bacillus anthracis(MIC=0.5µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis PCI 219(MIC=0.5µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus 209P(MIC=1.0µg/ml),Micrococcus luteus(MIC=1.0µg/ml),Streptococcus pneumoniae(MIC=0.5-1.0µg/ml),Streptococcus pyogenes(MIC=1.0),Corynebacterium diphtheriae(MIC=0.5µg/ml),Shigella dysenteriae(MIC=>100µg/ml),Shigella flexneri(MIC=>100µg/ml),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhi(MIC=>100µg/ml),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Paratyphi A(MIC=>100µg/ml),Escherichia coli(MIC=>100µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=>100µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae(MIC=>100µg/ml),Mycobacterium tuberculosis H37Rv(MIC=>100µg/ml)
